intro: Ramonda, commonly known as the mountain sorrel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Geraniaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. Ramonda species are often found in rocky or alpine environments, where they thrive in well-drained soils.
